intro: Gustavia paucisperma, commonly known as the scarlet pimento, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central America. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink and red. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 6 meters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a slightly hairy texture. The fruit is a small, fleshy berry that turns red when mature, containing several small seeds.
